name: E3 Expo
short_description: The premier event for computer, video game, and related products.
long_description: The Electronic Entertainment Expo (E3) is a premier trade event for the video game industry. At E3, major video game publishers showcase upcoming games and hardware, attracting media coverage and industry attention. It is held annually in Los Angeles, California.

specifications.attendees: Industry professionals, media, and gaming enthusiasts

name: Gamescom
long_description: Gamescom is the largest gaming event in the world, attracting hundreds of thousands of visitors each year. It features exhibitions, panel discussions, and hands-on demos of upcoming games from both major publishers and indie developers.

specifications.attendees: Gamers, developers, publishers, and industry professionals

name: BlizzCon
long_description: BlizzCon is an annual gaming convention held by Blizzard Entertainment to celebrate its major franchises, including Warcraft, StarCraft, Diablo, Hearthstone, and Overwatch. The event features announcements, panels, tournaments, and community events.

name: PAX East
long_description: PAX East is a gaming convention dedicated to celebrating gaming culture and community. It features panels, exhibitions, tournaments, and opportunities for gamers to connect with each other.

specifications.venue: Boston Convention and Exhibition Center, Boston, Massachusetts
specifications.attendees: Gamers, developers, publishers, and industry professionals

name: DreamHack
long_description: DreamHack is the world's largest digital festival, featuring esports tournaments, LAN parties, cosplay, and gaming exhibitions. It attracts gamers and enthusiasts from around the globe.

name: The International
long_description: The International is an annual Dota 2 esports tournament hosted by Valve Corporation. It features the world's best Dota 2 teams competing for millions of dollars in prize money.

name: QuakeCon
short_description: The ultimate celebration of id Software and its games.
long_description: QuakeCon is an annual gaming convention dedicated to id Software and its games, including the Quake, Doom, and Wolfenstein series. The event features tournaments, panels, and exhibitions.

specifications.venue: Gaylord Texan Resort & Convention Center, Grapevine, Texas

name: Tokyo Game Show
long_description: Tokyo Game Show is Asia's largest gaming event, showcasing the latest trends and developments in the gaming industry. It features exhibitions, panels, and hands-on demos of upcoming games.

specifications.attendees: Gamers, developers, publishers, and industry professionals
